laboratory_examinations.findings: Focal fatty infiltration at the ligamentum teres hepatis; a simple cyst in the peripheral right lobe of the liver; no liver mass detected; gallbladder normal; pancreas, spleen, adrenal glands, and visualized bowel within normal limits; kidneys enhance and excrete symmetrically; no free fluid or free air in abdomen. In the sigmoid colon, there is focal wall thickening and inflammatory stranding surrounding a focal outpouching; several small adjacent foci of fluid and a punctate focus of air within the inflammatory change; no drainable fluid collection detected in pelvis.
